thread.title: Traveling water slide attracts 3,000 people to Akron street
thread.title_full: Traveling water slide attracts 3,000 people to Akron street - seattlepi.com

author: seattlepi
title: Traveling water slide attracts 3,000 people to Akron street
text:
AKRON, Ohio (AP) â€” More than 3,000 people took to Akron's University Avenue to get a chance to ride a three-lane, 780-foot-long water slide along the downtown street.
The Akron Beacon Journal reports ( http://bit.ly/1K0mMvn ) Sunday was the debut of Slide the City's traveling water slide attraction in Akron.
The vinyl slide with inflatable side bumpers is making rounds across the country this summer, including stops in Cincinnati and Youngstown.
Slide the City crew member Jessica Brinks says Akron's slide was one of the steepest she's seen. The wild ride extended from University Avenue to Main Street, ending near Lock 3 Park.
Officials say wait times averaged 30 to 45 minutes at the sold-out event, which cost $15 for a single ride.
Organizers collected donations for the United Way in exchange for inflating inner tubes.
___
Information from: Akron Beacon Journal, http://www.ohio.com
